element.name: Howth Cliff Walk - Drumleck Point by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)
element.description: The fifth of 6 caches along the Howth Cliff Walk.

long-description.p:
The Howth Cliff Walk offers the walker a fine, varied walk around an open hillside and the Howth cliffs, with the guarantee of plentiful bird life, excellent sea views and colourful wild flowers.
The walk can be commenced at many different places along the route, with many easy access points from various car parks that are conveniently located close to the path. This caching trail commences at the car park 1km to the east of the village (N53 23.137 W6 03.048) and moves slowly south, then west, but can also be undertaken in a reverse order.
While the main walk is generally not very steep, a couple of caches may require some scrambling up brief stretches of steep terrain. As always in Ireland it is advised to bring along good waterproof clothing for the inevitable shower. Sturdy footware is also a must. If you wish to undertake the entire walk in one go it makes sense to bring a packed lunch and plenty of liquids, as the full journey may take in the region of 4-5 hours.
This cache is located on the beach beside Drumleck Point. There is a clear path down to the beach, but care is needed to reach it. Also, this cache becomes less easily accessible when the tide comes in, so please try to time your visit around the tide being out.
Apparently this beach was formerly a private beach, owned by the Jameson family (the whiskey people). The gate at the top of the path was their private entrance to the beach. Nearby is the remains of a swimming pool which the family had constructed. (Thanks to Moonshiner Extraordinaire for this additional info!)
The cache is hidden under a small rock. Please replace the cache so that it is not visible.

element.encoded-hints: Vertical crack in between long grey boulders

ul.li:
2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by SharpSwords
Nice one along the cliffs. We felt like we were in an adventure movie of Indiana Jones! We had a little picnic and play on the beach! We had loads of fun and we climbed a lot. Jake climbed up over the top of a cave and jumped down the other side! We saw some muggles but they didnt see what we were doing! [:D] [8D] [;)] [:o)]

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2408
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
Our second, and last cache of the series. It was getting late, and we were getting tired; but we were curious to return one day. We didn't knew we needed to go down to the beach, but i happy we went [:D]
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by eclipsearch
13.40 Found on a school trip to Dublin
TFTC
greetings from Germany eclipsearch

2010-05-08T19:00:00Z : Found it by Thinas
Fond on Howth Cliff Walk around Howth peninsula. Very nice walk in windy but sunny weather, No trade. Thanks for the cache,

2010-04-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by premg
First of 3 geocaches on another sunny day. Enjoyed hike down to the beach and shivered as we watched Mum and Son team go for a very quick dip!!! Will be back in the Summer to try out the swimming pool. SL TFTC
